intro: Aegiphila glabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale blue or violet, arranged in whorls along the stem. Aegiphila glabrata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to coastal environments.
